snippet: Mitt Romney flew to South Carolina Thursday to begin what might be his biggest challenge yet: convincing Republicans in this socially conservative state that he is the candidate who best represents their values.
abstract: Mitt Romney flies to South Carolina to begin what might be his biggest challenge yet: convincing Republicans in this socially conservative state that he is the candidate who best represents their values.

byline.original: By SUSAN SAULNY and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from Salem, N.H., and Michael Shear from Manchester, N.H.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney flew to South Carolina Thursday to begin what might be his biggest challenge yet: convincing Republicans in this socially conservative state that he is the candidate who best represents their values.

headline.seo: Santorum Courts Romney Territory in New Hampshire
headline.main: Romney, in South Carolina, Sets His Sights on Obama
headline.print_headline: Romney, in South Carolina, Sets His Sights on Obama
